abstract: A European Central Bank study shows about half of 105 banks surveyed said that liquidity in the unsecured market, in which banks lend to each other without requiring collateral, had worsened from last year — a reminder that the banking system remains fragile.
snippet: A European Central Bank study shows about half of 105 banks surveyed said that liquidity in the unsecured market, in which banks lend to each other without requiring collateral, had worsened from last year — a reminder that the banking system rema...
lead_paragraph: Money markets in the euro zone continue to function unevenly while the overall volume of transactions has declined from last year, data released by the European Central Bank indicated on Thursday. It was a reminder that the banking system remains fragile, Jack Ewing writes in The New York Times.

headline.main: Europe’s Financial Footing Is Rocky, E.C.B. Says

abstract: Norway’s central bank has sued Citigroup over $835 million in losses on Citi shares and bonds.
snippet: Norway’s central bank has sued Citigroup over $835 million in losses on Citi shares and bonds.
lead_paragraph: Norway’s central bank has sued Citigroup over $835 million in losses on Citi shares and bonds.

headline.main: Citigroup Sued by Norway’s Central Bank

abstract: One great feature is the ability to deposit checks with a smartphone, but few banks offer the service.
snippet: One great feature is the ability to deposit checks with a smartphone, but few banks offer the service.
lead_paragraph: Banks want many of us to start paying monthly fees again for our checking accounts. So why won’t they give us something worth paying for?

headline.main: If Customers Have to Pay for Checking, They Should Be Consoled With Perks
headline.print_headline: If Customers Have to Pay for Checking, They Should Be Consoled With Perks
